results.name: Cold Start Quality & Topic Breadth (First Impression Test)

criteria_results.description: API response includes cold_start: true
Average credibility of top 10 >= 3.0
No episode in top 10 has credibility < 2
Top 3 episodes have quality_score >= 0.7
LLM Judge: Recommendations match user interests and Content Hypothesis
LLM Judge: Appropriate variety for user's exploration/specialization profile
LLM Judge: High-quality, credible sources surfaced
LLM Judge: Recommendations align with Content Hypothesis

llm_evaluation.summary: The recommendations successfully surface high-quality content, aligning with the hypothesis for a cold start user. However, the list is heavily skewed towards AI, failing to maximize initial diversity across the specified major themes (AI, Crypto, Macro, Startups) and instead showing depth in one category rather than balanced breadth. This imbalance hinders the goal of probing unknown user interests effectively.

This imbalance hinders the goal of probing unknown user interests effectively.

results.name: Personalization Differs from Cold Start (Centroid Shift Test)

criteria_results.description: At least 5 of top 10 episodes are different
VC Partner has higher avg similarity_score than cold start
VC Partner cold_start flag is false
LLM Judge: Recommendations match user interests and Content Hypothesis
LLM Judge: Appropriate variety for user's exploration/specialization profile
LLM Judge: High-quality, credible sources surfaced
LLM Judge: Recommendations align with Content Hypothesis

llm_evaluation.summary: The recommendations demonstrate exceptional alignment with the user's content hypothesis, focusing heavily on AI/Tech infrastructure and strategic analysis (85% specialization). They subtly incorporate cross-disciplinary curiosity (15%) through 'bridge' content linking AI to macro themes like space, sovereignty, and economic impact, precisely as requested. All recommendations are high-quality and strategic, reflecting the user's stated preferences and showing strong sensitivity to engagement signals.

criteria_results.description: Both test episodes found in top 10 cold start results
Recent episode has higher recency_score than older
Recent episode ranks higher (lower position) than older
Scenarios produce different recommendations (at least 2 different episodes)
Scenario B (bookmark crypto) has more crypto episodes than Scenario A

LLM Judge: Appropriate variety for user's exploration/specialization profile

llm_evaluation.summary: The recommendations clearly prioritize crypto content, with the top three items directly related to crypto, reflecting the user's two crypto bookmarks. This demonstrates that bookmark engagements are weighted more heavily than the single AI click, aligning perfectly with the inferred content hypothesis of strong crypto interest.
